titleStmt.title: Humarec Manuscript Viewer - Marciana Gr. Z. 11 (379)

availability.p: Visit the Humarec Homepage for more information.

msContents.summary: Marciana Gr. Z 11 (379) contains the Acts, the Catholic letters and the letters of Paul in Greek, Latin and Arabic. This is the only trilingual Greek, Latin and Arabic manuscriptin the GA list. The manuscript is not dated but was estimated to the 12th or 13th century. It comes probably from Sicily.

msItem.title: Catholic Letters
msItem.note: Argumenta and tabula capitum precede each letter.

msItem.title: Letters of Paul
msItem.note: With the exception of 1 Corinthians, argumenta and tabula capitum precede each letter.

بيعه اللّه التى بقورنثه //

لكم الامتنان و السّلم من اللّه

ربنا يسوع المسيح // ان نقولوا

و قد صبغت بيت

و البشرا // وليس بحكمة المنطق //

Verbum enim crucis pereun
tibus quidem stultitia est ·
his autem qui salvi fiunt id est
nobis vir tusdei est ·
v Scriptum est enim · perdam sa
pientiam sapientium ·

probabo · Ubi sapiens ? ubi

tionis salvos facere
credentes · quoniam et
iudei signa petunt ·
et greci sapientiam
querunt · nos autem predi
camus christum crucifixum ·

gentibus autem stulticiam ip
sis autem vocatis iudeis at
que grecis ~ christum dei virtu
tem et dei sapientiam · quia quod
stultum est dei sapientius est

فان القول بالصليب // هو
جهل عند الظالّينالضالّين // و هو
للمنجيّن و نحن اوليك
قدره اللّه //
فقد كتب // سَاُتلف
حكمه العلما // و امقت
نُبل النُّبلا //
اعراضًا عنه // اين الحكيم //
ابن الكاتب // اين طالب هذه
الدنيا // اليس قد
استجهل اللّه علم
هذه الدّنيا // فكما انه
كاںكان ڡىفي علم اللّه //
الا يفهم اهل الدّنيا اللّه
بعلمهم // اراد اللّه
ان يخلّص المومنين
بجهاله الشارعين //
لان اليهود يسءلونيسألون
الايات // و اليونانين
يطلبون الحكمه //
و نحن نشرع ان المسيح
صلب // و هذا القول
عند اليهود فتنه الزلق //
و عند اليونانين جهل و نقصٌ //
و عند المدعين و اليهود //
و اليونانين المسيح قدره اللّه //
وَ عِلم اللّه // لان الذي هو جهل
عند اللّه // هو اعلم
The initial is partly hidden by the previous folio.
This sign is a question mark. It is used quite often in the manuscript; see the following lines.

back.note: ἰησοῦ χριστοῦ: same word order as in ℵ A L P Ψ 81. 104. 365. 630. 1175. 1241. 1505. 1506. 1739. 1881. 2464 𝔐 b vgst sy
om. ἰησοῦ
om. ἡμῶν
θεοῦ: as in B* F G 81. 1175 sams
om. ἐν
αὐτοῦ instead of αὐτῇ
ἡμῶν instead of ὑμῶν
as in ℵ2 C D F G L P Ψ 104 365 630 1175 1241 1505 1506 1881 2464 𝔐 lat boms; τω θεω μου in A 33. 81. 326 ar vgmss syp.h** sams bomss. In the latin column: deo meo. In the Arabic column: إلهَى

as in C3 D F G L P Ψ 1241 1505 1881 2464 𝔐 it sy. ἐβαπτίσθητε in P46 ℵ A B C* 6 33 81 365 630 1175 1506 1739 f* vg syhmg co. See the Latin baptizaverim and its note. The Arabic column has a 2nd-person plural صُبغتم
Not mentioned in NA28 edition and not present in Latin and Arabic. Influence of a lectionary?
om. γὰρ
Singular σημεῖον: reading not mentioned in NA28 edition
Other Vulgate witnesses have: Christi. Cod. Boernerianus and Augiensis have dei as well.
in A R F S: confirmavit.
deo meo: as in R F S Φ. It does not correspond to the Greek column, see note.

Other Vulgate witnesses have: baptizati sitis (exception: a note in Cod. Augiensis). This reading may be influenced by the Greek reading εβαπτισα (in the bilingual Cod. Augiensis as well). Arabic column has a 2nd-person plural صُبغتم
om. et
المقاله corresponds to the Latin reading sententia (in K C Λ 𝔠), against scienta as in the Latin colum.
The Arabic column has a 2nd-person plural; Greek and Latin have a 1st-person singular
Singular reading
